channel.title: International News@Emory
channel.description: All the latest news from Emory University.

item.title: Future of Libya: Emory Experts Available
item.description: Emory University has faculty experts available to discuss the situation in Libya, the death of Moammar Gadhafi, and what the future of the country and transitional government may be.y

item.title: Emory Hosts France-Atlanta 2011 Symposia on Kidney Disease Treatment
item.description: French and American scientists, academics and physicians will gather at Emory University in early November for two one-day conferences focusing on innovation in the treatment of chronic kidney disease across the globe. Both events are free and open to the public.

item.title: Is the U.S. Headed Toward a Second Recession? Emory Expert Weighs In
item.description: With employment growing at a very slow pace and government in-fighting getting in the way of needed economic policy responses, Emory University visiting economics scholar Sheila Tschinkel says a second recession is still possible, even if it is not the most likely outcome.

item.title: Conference on Maritime China Signals Shift in Scholarship of East Asian History
item.description: Top scholars from around the world will gather at Emory University for a conference on ChinaÂ¿s vast maritime trade and its impact on global history on Oct. 27-29.

item.title: Emory Vaccine Center Partners With Global Initiative to Boost Vaccine Research and Development
item.description: A team of 42 universities and research institutions in 13 countries will work to accelerate human vaccine development through a new collaborative research program named Advanced Immunization Technologies.

item.title: CNN Dialogues Forum on Social Media to Feature Top Trendmakers Oct. 12
item.description: CNN Dialogues will host its second event, "Living in the Age of Social Media - the Good, the Bad and the Surprising," on Wednesday, Oct. 12 at 7 p.m. Panelists include musician Pete Wentz, innovator Baratunde Thurston, author Maggie Jackson and pastor Shaun King.

item.title: PODCAST: A Soldier Betrayed in Cuba's Struggle for Freedom
item.description: Emory English and African American Studies professor Mark Sanders edited and translated Afro-Cuban war veteran Ricardo Batrell's autobiography.

item.title: Emory Hosts Global Summit on Cardio-Metabolic Syndrome
item.description: Medical experts from around the world will gather at Emory University Oct. 13-14 to discuss the prevention and treatment of the rising global epidemic of cardio-metabolic syndrome.

item.title: 2011 Emory Medalists Honored for Dedication to the Greater Good
item.description: Two of Emory University's most distinguished and dedicated graduates will receive one of the university's highest honors, the Emory Medal, Thursday, Oct. 6 in a special ceremony on campus.

item.title: Exhibition Sheds Light on Expatriates in Paris
item.description: Paris of the 1920s is the focus of a new exhibition "Shadows of the Sun: The Crosbys, the Black Sun Press and the Lost Generation," on display now in the Schatten Gallery at Emory University's Woodruff Library.

item.title: At the Decatur Book Festival: Images From Haitian Life After Disaster
item.description: Emory staff photographer and documentarian Bryan Meltz's images capture the country as life continued in the year after the earthquake. Her book will be featured at the AJC Decatur Book Festival, where she will be signing books in the Emory tent on Sunday, Sept. 4 at 1:30 p.m.

item.title: Emory Expert: Are We Witnessing a True Revolution in Libya?
item.description: Emory Middle Eastern history and Islamic studies professor Kenneth Stein is an expert in the Middle East, American foreign policy in the region and the modern Arab world.

item.title: Emory Experts Discuss the Future of Libya
item.description: As drastic change continues in Libya, Emory University experts are available to discuss the future of the country, the difficulties Libya faces transitioning to a democracy and the role the international community should play in the formation of the new government.

item.title: Rushdie Named to New Position at Emory
item.description: Acclaimed author Salman Rushdie will continue his affiliation with Emory University with a new title, as University Distinguished Professor, reflecting more expansive activities, according to an announcement by University Provost Earl Lewis.

item.title: Jewish Perspectives on 9/11 Focus of New Book
item.description: As the 10th anniversary of 9/11 approaches, a new book titled "Contending With Catastrophe: Jewish Perspectives on September 11th," edited by Jewish law expert Michael Broyde of Emory University, is a reminder that the events of that day raised issues no one could have anticipated.
